name: Nancy Grace Roman
summary: Astronomer known as the 'Mother of Hubble' for her role in planning and developing the Hubble Space Telescope.
shortDescription: Nancy Grace Roman was an American astronomer who was the first Chief of Astronomy at NASA. She is known as the 'Mother of Hubble' for her crucial role in developing the Hubble Space Telescope.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Nashville, Tennessee, Nancy showed early interest in astronomy. She earned her PhD in astronomy from the University of Chicago.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Nancy joined NASA in 1959 and became the first Chief of Astronomy. She played a crucial role in developing the Hubble Space Telescope.
detailed_description.challenges: As a woman in astronomy and NASA, Nancy faced gender discrimination. She also had to advocate for space-based astronomy.
detailed_description.achievements: First Chief of Astronomy at NASA, played crucial role in developing Hubble Space Telescope, and advanced space-based astronomy.
detailed_description.legacy: Nancy's work revolutionized space-based astronomy and inspired generations of women in space science.
